1.verse: The elder to the well-beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth.

2.verse: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.

3.verse: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

4.verse: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

5.verse: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;

6.verse: Who have borne testimony of thy charity before the church: whom if thou shalt bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou wilt do well:

7.verse: Because for his name's sake they went forth, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

8.verse: We therefore ought to receive such, that we may be fellow-helpers to the truth.

9.verse: I wrote to the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the pre-eminence among them, receiveth us not.

10.verse: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content with that, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.

11.verse: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.

12.verse: Demetrius hath good report by all men, and by the truth itself: and we also bear testimony; and ye know that our testimony is true.

13.verse: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write to thee:

14.verse: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face.

15.verse: Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Greet the friends by name.
